cdes.cdeName: Spinal cord injury etiology type
cdes.definitionDescription: Etiology of the spinal cord injury. Traumatic spinal cord injury is impairment of the spinal cord or cauda equina function resulting from the application of an external force of any magnitude.
cdes.permissibleDescription: 1=Sports;2=Assault;3=Transport;4=Fall;5=Other traumatic cause;6=Non-traumatic spinal cord dysfunction;9=Unspecified or Unknown;
cdes.instructions: Because it is possible that an injury event may be classifiable into more than one of these categories, the following prioritization has been established for assigning codes: First coding priority is given to sports. If the injury event involved sports it should be coded as a 1 (Sports) regardless of whether it involved assault, transport or a fall. Code 1 would be appropriate whenever the ICECI Injury Activity Axis would be coded as  sports and exercise during leisure time  (ICECI Injury Activity code 4) regardless of coding on other ICECI Axes. Second priority is given to Assault. If the event did not involve sports but it did involve an assault, then the event should be coded as a 2 (Assault) regardless of whether it involved transport or a fall. Code 2 would be appropriate whenever the ICECI Intent of Injury Axis would be coded as  assault  (ICECI Intent of Injury code 3) and the ICECI Injury Activity Axis would not be coded as  sports and exercise during leisure time  (ICECI Injury Activity code 4) regardless of other ICECI Axes. Third priority is given to Transport. If the event was neither sports nor assault related but it involved transport, then the event should be coded as 3 (Transport) regardless of whether it involved a fall. Code 3 would be appropriate whenever the ICECI External Cause of Injury Axis would be coded as  transport injury event  (ICECI External Cause of Injury code 1.1) and ICECI Intent of Injury Axis would not be coded as  assault  (ICECI Intent of Injury code 3) and ICECI Injury Activity Axis would not be coded as  sports and exercise during leisure time  (ICECI Injury Activity code 4). Fourth priority is given to Fall. If the event was neither sports, assault nor transport related and it involved a fall then it should be coded as 4 (Fall). Code 4 would be appropriate whenever the ICECI External Cause of Injury Axis would be coded as  falling, stumbling, or jumping  (ICECI External Cause of Injury code 1.5) and ICECI Intent of Injury Axis would not be coded as  assault  (ICECI Intent of Injury code 3) and ICECI Injury Activity Axis would not be coded as  sports and exercise during leisure time  (ICECI Injury Activity code 4). Use code 5 (other traumatic cause) for all other known (specified) traumatic causes whenever codes 1 through 4 of this etiology variable do not apply. Paralysis secondary to surgical procedures when the patient does not have a neurological deficit prior to surgery would be coded in this category. Use code 6 (non-traumatic cause) if there is impairment of the spinal cord or cauda equina function that is not caused either directly or indirectly by an external event.
cdes.referrences: DeVivo M, Biering-Sørensen F, Charlifue S, Noonan V, Post M, Stripling T, Wing P. International Spinal Cord Injury Core Data Set. Spinal Cord 2006 Sep;44(9):535-40.

description: Contains data elements that monitor the participant's/subject's heart rhythms for 24 hours. [Examples of CDEs included: Maximum heart rate; Episodes of heart block; Premature atrial contractions]

cdes.cdeName: Holter exam start date and time
cdes.definitionDescription: Date (and time, if applicable and known) the Holter examination of the participant/ subject began
cdes.instructions: Record the date/time according to the ISO 8601, the International Standard for the representation of dates and times (http://www.iso.org/iso/home.html).  The date/time should be recorded to the level of granularity known (e.g., year, year and month, complete date plus hours and minutes, etc.).
cdes.referrences: ISO 8601 - http://www.iso.org/iso/iso_catalogue.htm
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined
cdes.previousTitle: Holter exam start date and time

cdes.instructions: Record the date/time according to the ISO 8601, the International Standard for the representation of dates and times (http://www.iso.org/iso/home.html).  The date/time should be recorded to the level of granularity known (e.g., year, year and month, complete date plus hours and minutes, etc.).

cdes.previousTitle: Holter exam end date and time
